full_summary:
**Request for Standing Offer**

### Title

Blood Borne/Sexually Transmitted Infectious Diseases/Harm Reduction and Addiction Education, Prevention, and Support Services for federal institutions in New Brunswick and in Nova Scotia

### Procurement Details

- **Reference Number**: cb-710-3843050
- **Tender Closing Date**: March 11, 2024, 13:00:00
- **Expected Contract Start Date**: April 1, 2024
- **Expected Contract End Date**: March 31, 2029
- **Procurement Category**: SRV
- **Procurement Method**: Competitive - Open Bidding
- **Trade Agreements**: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

### Description

The Correctional Service of Canada seeks a standing offer for Blood Borne/Sexually Transmitted Infectious Diseases/Harm Reduction and Addiction Education, Prevention, and Support Services for federal institutions in New Brunswick and in Nova Scotia. The services will be delivered over a period of five years, with an option to renew for four additional one-year periods.

The incumbent will provide prevention interventions such as educational learning opportunities and support services to reduce the transmission of infectious diseases to federal inmates in New Brunswick and Nova Scotia. The services will be delivered in collaboration with the Health Care Teams directly to inmates through non-judgmental and non-coercive strategies.

The primary objectives of this project are to provide client-centered education and support services on the topics of harm reduction associated with Blood Borne/Sexually Transmitted Infectious Diseases (BBSTI), addiction and substance use, and to provide prevention interventions to reduce the transmission of infectious diseases such as HIV and Hepatitis.

### Scope of Work

The scope of work includes:

- Deliver a one-half-day Hepatitis and HIV/AIDS related workshop and provide awareness resources.
- Deliver two separate one-half-day workshops on the Prevention of Blood borne and Sexually Transmitted Infectious Diseases to inmates.
- Provide two separate one-half-day workshops on harm reduction initiatives and safe drug usage.
- Provide two separate one-on-one individual support meetings to HIV/Hepatitis positive inmates.
- Provide four separate group support meetings to clients with addictions.
- Participate in activities and committees related to quality improvement, patient safety, and accreditation within the institution.
- Provide resource materials for each session that are innovative and interactive to educate and engage all participants.
- Deliver the one-on-one sessions in English or French as per the choice of the individual and deliver the group sessions or workshops in a bilingual
